definition: to cooperate/to harmonize/to help/to assist/to join
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
oblique tone/nonlevel tone/uneven tone (the third tone of Classical Chinese)
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
punctuation of a sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/period 句號|句号 and comma 逗號|逗号/sentences and phrases
